intro: Fimbristylis comata, commonly known as the hairy flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes, typically blooming during the rainy season. Fimbristylis comata thrives in wetland environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Its adaptability to moist soils makes it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
